intro: Strychnos lanceolaris, commonly known as the arrowleaf strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 3 meters. Strychnos lanceolaris is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
